page.title: 03Sandridge J.M.I. School
page.content: Sandridge School has a big field around it and overlooks farmland. It is a small school with 98 children and 5 teachers.85 of the children have school dinners,which they eat in the school hall. Most classes have under 30 pupils.The children do not have set homework.The school has a BBC computer.They do not have a school bus. They do cooking and do outdoor sports twice a week.They play netball and rounders but don't play against other schools in matches.They go swimming at Westminster Lodge in St.Albans once a week.Every morning except Monday they have an assembly. They have a television but not a video.As there is no secondary school in Sandridge the children go to secondary schools in St Albans and Wheathampstead. The school has been open since 1864; 124 years ago.
